item.title: Israel withdraws from a Gaza hospital, AT&T data breach affects millions of users
item.description: Israeli forces have withdrawn from a Gaza hospital after a two-week assault, AT&T says a data breach has compromised the personal data of current and former users.

item.title: Dairy cows test positive for bird flu, but officials say risk to public is low
item.description: Bird flu has been detected in cattle in several states. Its believed to be the first time the disease has infected dairy cows.

item.title: 5 tips for not getting tricked online this April Fools' Day — and beyond
item.description: It's always smart to keep your guard up online, especially on April Fools' Day. Experts in misinformation and news literacy offer steps you can take to avoid getting fooled, and not just on Monday.

item.title: ACA health insurance plans are being switched without enrollees' OK
item.description: Rogue insurance agents access consumer information on the Affordable Care Act federal marketplace and make the changes. Policyholders can lose their doctors and end up owing back taxes.

item.description: Due to fears of "cancellation," alternative technology and financial platforms are being built for the so-called freedom economy by figures on the far right, including those with antisemitic beliefs.

item.title: Lead in the drinking water is still a problem in the U.S. — especially in Chicago
item.description: The Windy City has the most lead pipes of any U.S. city. A study estimates that more than two-thirds of children there are exposed to lead in their home tap water.

item.title: Half a million California workers will get $20 minimum wage, starting today
item.description: It's a big win for cooks, cashiers and other fast-food employees, among the least paid in the workforce. Restaurant owners and franchisees warn of higher prices and cuts to workers' hours.
